name: heat and power co-generation unit construction, 1MWel | heat and power co-generation unit, organic Rankine cycle, 1MWe, 6.4 MWth | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/14076/documentation

This dataset comprises the reference flow 'heat and power cogeneration unit 1MW electric 6.4 MWt'. This data set is based on a data set comprised in the book 'Energy from the earth'. (see field 'published source' for more details). The inventory for the heat and power generating unit is basically taken from (Bauer, 2007).

Material and energy for construction of the cogeneration unit.

Cogeneration unit.
category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/422:Construction of utility projects/4220:Construction of utility projects

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Represents installation of a deep geothermal power plant in Switzerland.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: This infrastructure referes to the cogeneration unit existing in Switzerland.

publication.name: S Hirchberg, S Wiemer, P Burgherr2015

exchanges.description:
Literature value/estimation. The amount of the steel mass is estimated based on a 1 MW plant in (Rogge, 2004). Weights of the different ORC components: Evaporator (11 t), boiler (4 t), turbine(3 t), generator (4 t),pump for working fluid (1 t), condenser of the organic circulating fluid (16 t) 
Low alloyed steel is an Organic rankine cycle component.

exchanges.description:
Calculated from an input of 300 kg Perfluoropentane (Density 1.664 g/ml) and a density of 0.874 g/ml for Benzene. 
This item belongs to the working fluid category of the LCI.
Source Rogge, S. (2004). Geothermische Stromerzeugung in Deutschland Ökonomie , Ökologie und
Potenziale. Technical University Berlin, Germany.

exchanges.description:
Literature value/estimation. The amount of the steel mass is estimated based on a 1 MW plant in (Rogge, 2004).
Weights of the different ORC components:  Evaporator (11 t),
boiler (4 t), turbine (3 t), generator (4 t), pump for working fluid
(1 t), condenser of the organic circulating fluid (16 t)
Rogge, S. (2004). Geothermische Stromerzeugung in Deutschland Ökonomie , Ökologie und Potenziale. Technical University Berlin, Germany.
